frameDefinitions: An Agent manipulates an Instrument in order to achieve a Purpose.
The size of an Entity is assessed in terms of the Degree by which it deviates from the norm.
An Entity meets the pre-conditions for participating in an Event.
A Potential_hindrance or an Agent (via their actions) keeps an Event from taking place, or despite the possibility of prevent the Event, do not do so.
In this frame, an Authority allows a Protagonist to know (in some way) that they may or may not engage in an Action.
The existence of a State_of_affairs is sufficient reason for taking an Action .
frameExamples: For cold conditions, we recommend that you <t>use</t> a heat gun or a hair dryer to make the adhesive work better.
Conductor software gives us the hands-on <t>capability</t> to provide updates immediately
Rain <t>prevented</t> the ball game from taking place.
The police officer <t>forbid</t> me from turning around .
The underwater sequences <t>warrant</t> the price of the admission alone.
listRoleDefinitions: The Agent uses the Instrument to achieve their Purpose.
This role identifies the purpose for which an Agent uses the Instrument.
An entity directed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that serves to bring about the <fen>Purpose</fen> of the <fen>Agent</fen>.
An <fen>Instrument</fen> that has a function associated with it.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> uses the <fen>Instrument</fen>.
This role identifies the place where the Agent uses the Instrument.
The thing whose size is being considered.
The feature of an (actual or possible) <fen>Entity</fen> that is measured. In literal examples, it essentially must be size, or a word equivalent to size such as bulk.
The <fen>Entity</fen> whose meeting or falling short of pre-conditions is assessed.
The <fen>Event</fen> that the <fen>Entity</fen> may participate in.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> is capable of the <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> is the force which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening, or does not.
The <fen>Event</fen> is prevented from occurring by the <fen>Preventing_cause</fen> or the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the sentient being which keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from happening.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the <fen>Potential_hindrance</fen> or <fen>Agent</fen> keeps the <fen>Event</fen> from taking place.
The <fen>Authority</fen> orders the <fen>Protagonist</fen> to not engage in a particular <fen>Action</fen>.
The <fen>Protagonist</fen> wants to engage in an <fen>Action</fen>, but is ordered not to by the <fen>Authority</fen>.
The <fen>Action</fen> is what the <fen>Protagonist</fen> seeks to do, but is ordered not to.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the denying of permission occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the denial of permission occurs.
An Eventuality or an Entity that is taken to constitute sufficient reason for taking another <fen>Action</fen>.
An <fen>Action</fen> that is taken to be justifiable given the <fen>State_of_Affairs</fen>.
listRoleExamples: For cold conditions, we recommend using <fex>a heat gun or a hair dryer</fex> to make the adhesive work better.
Mirabella shared the mischievous vision of childlike exuberance and used the chair <fex>as a pseudo jungle gym</fex>.
I went and used that ball <fex>yesterday</fex> and i bowled 5 games and i left about 14 ten pins with it.
The particles were smaller <fex>in size</fex> than expected .
White House voices doubts about Aristide's ability <fex>to govern</fex>
<fex>A heavy contact to the opponent 's face</fex> may not merit just a verbal warning
